page.title: 13Footpaths around Cockerham
page.content: The footpaths around Cockerham form a network of communication across the farmlands of the area. Many are short connected by the local roads,others bisect the countryside and are used by walkers, ramblers and local people. Leading from farms and houses to the salt marshes to the west, Church and village in the centre and Lancaster Canal to the east.Two head eastwards behind the village, rising sharply, giving a wonderful view over Cockerham Sands, falling quickly again through grassland to the canal. Two lead north westerly coming out onto Hillam Lane. The lower one running alongside two small becks, branching westwards onto saltmarshes at Patty's.Some of these footpaths have been used very profitably to raise hundreds of pounds for church & school in the form of sponsored walks giving delight to all.
